job.title: Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer
job.description: TITLE: Data Scientist/Machine Learning EngineerLOCATION: RemoteDuration: 6-12 month to perm MUST HAVES:5+ Python software development for composition and modularity, debugging and following tracebacksStrong stats background and concepts including hypothesis testing, correlation, R squared, P-valueExperience with Pandas, NumPy, SciPy, PytorchTensorflow functional API, deep learningMathematics of machine learning- linear algebra, multivariable calculusSQL queryingHyperparameter optimization, regularizing regression modelsPLUSSES:Masters or PhD- HIGHLY preferred!!Ecommerce experience DAY TO DAY:    A company is looking for a Data Scientist/Machine Learning Engineer to sit remotely within the US. We follow industry standard practices for managing, collaboration, deployment and testing. We deploy and interact with resources on AWS. Responsibilities include:• Analyze large data sets by quantifying the data quality, identifying particular patterns, and visualizing results• Understand business problems and identify the right data sets and ML/Statistical approach to produce the desired outcomes• Adapt to account for changes and be able to propose alternative approaches• Ideate and develop analytics and modeling solutions cross-functionally to build customized, long-term, and sustainable solutions• Provide critical thought leadership and enhance organizational capabilities• Own machine learning pipelines end-to-end• Write production-grade machine learning code using standard engineering practices and deploy models to production• Improve codebase and lead/participate in code reviews with Research Scientists and Data Scientists• Help non-engineers develop their engineering skills• Mentor junior team members and contribute to a culture where everyone is valued
